intro: Casearia staffordiae, commonly known as the Stafford's casearia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It produces small, spherical berries that are typically red when mature. Casearia staffordiae is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
